p: Rudeolf Diesel has demonstrated the use of oil in an engine, but owing to it highly viscous, incomplete ignition, unwanted particulate substances and low volatility, it cannot suitably work like a conventional diesel in a modern engine designed for modern fuel, [6]. Therefore, various techniques such as pyrolysis, microemulsion and transesterification via catalytic conversion have been applied to overcome these problems [ 7, 8, 9]. However, transesterification techniques have been established to be highly effective, time-saving and economical among other [10].
